#Text=Many dead in Egyptian resort blasts
#Text=Friday , July 22 , 2005
#Text=A string of at least three explosions in Egyptian resort towns in the Sinai early Saturday morning has left at least 88 people dead and over 200 more wounded .
#Text=One blast occurred at 1am in Sharm el-Sheikh , apparently in the market area , and two others about 15 minutes later in Naama Bay , a nearby resort .
#Text=The explosions reportedly occurred outside hotels .
#Text=A witness told the AP that the four-star hotel Ghazala Gardens has " completely burned down " .
#Text=In October of last year , 34 people were killed in explosions in Taba and Ras Shitan , nearby resort areas popular with Israeli tourists .
#Text=Due to this , officials blamed those attacks on violence related to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict .
#Text=Casualty reports
#Text=So far
#Text=the local police have confirmed that at least 88 people have been killed and between 120 and 200 were wounded .
#Text=Reuters news agency quotes doctors at the scene saying many of the injured are in critical condition .
#Text=Reuters also indicates that the explosions may have been caused by car-bombs .
#Text=Most of the casualties are Egyptians , there are Britons , French , Spaniards , Dutch , Italians , Czechs , Qataris , and Kuwaitis .
#Text=Responsibility
#Text=A group calling itself Abdullah Azzam Brigades has claimed responsibility for the attacks .
#Text=On a website the group stated that " holy warriors targeted the Ghazala Gardens hotel and the Old Market in Sharm el-Sheikh " and claimed it has ties to Al-Qaida .
#Text=The authenticity of this statement has not been verified .
#Text=Reactions
#Text=In a televised statement
#Text=Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak said that the terrorists will only make his country " more determined to pursue terrorism and dig it out by the roots " .
#Text=He added that " we will not give in to its blackmail , or seek a truce " .
#Text=Egyptian Interior Minister Habib al-Adli called the attacks an " ugly act of terrorism " .
#Text=U.S. Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice condemned the attacks saying that the " United States stands with our friend and ally Egypt .

#Text=While being questioned about who was responsible for the bombings , Mr Straw said :  Almost certainly they are evil people who will claim — wrongly — to have done this in the name of Islam . "

column1: #Text=Danish minister of Foreign Affairs Per Stig Møller says :
#Text=" I condemn , in the strongest possible ways , the terror attacks in Sharm el-Sheikh , that yet again target defenseless and innocent people .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=In a telegram to the Egyptian President this morning , Mrs. Maryam Rajavi , the President-elect of the National Council of Resistance of Iran , offered her condolences to the  brother nation of Egypt " on the death of , and injury to , a large number of Egyptian and foreign nationals during the bombings in Sharm al-Sheikh last night .

column1: #Text=She prayed for patience for the families of those killed and quick recovery for those injured .
#Text=Mrs. Rajavi underscored , " Islamic fundamentalism and the terrorism emanating from it constitute the biggest threat to world peace and security .
